‚ÄúGovernments have a role in ensuring that people have consistent and accessible opportunities to engage with the arts, regardless of their ability to pay. The health benefits of the arts will only happen if we normalise and facilitate arts and cultural engagement as part of everyone‚Äôs daily lives.‚Äù GCDN‚Äôs latest report ‚ÄòCulture for health: implications and opportunities for cultural districts‚Äô includes a suite of policy proposals and recommended actions for decision-makers, elected officials, planners and investors. We highlight a fewüëá Read the full report here: https://lnkd.in/ga6-mm6d The report was authored by Rosie Dow and developed in partnership with the Social Biobehavioural Research Group, University College London (UCL SBB), as part of GCDN‚Äôs mission to catalyze new thinking on ways to improve the quality of urban life through the contribution of the arts, culture, and the creative industries. #cultureforhealth #culturaldistrict #artsresearch #publichealth

Welcome to Lambeth HDRCs official LinkedIn page. We are pleased to be working in partnership with many organisations including King's College London Black Thrive NIHR Applied Research Collaboration (ARC) South London Mabadiliko CIC to use local evidence and experience to understand and act on the causes of health inequalities in Lambeth. We are funded by NIHR (National Institute for Health and Care Research) #HDRC #HealthInequalities #Lambeth London Borough of Lambeth Hiten Dodhia Ruth Hutt Sophia Looney Charlotte Afuape Demelza Smeeth Arundeep Chaggar Abbie Ametewee Mipimebou Everstina Musamabik Emily Aidoo
